required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study On The Safety And Tolerability Of Prolonged Thrombosis Prophylaxis With Fragmin®
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Study On The Safety And Tolerability Of Prolonged Thrombosis Prophylaxis With Fragmin® (Dalteparin Sodium) In Patients Undergoing Major Orthopedic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to observe the safety, tolerability, and compliance in the use of Fragmin® for prolonged thromboprophylaxis in post-surgery high-risk orthopedic patients.

detailed_description.textblock: All patients prescribed Fragmin® (Dalteparin Sodium) for prolonged thromboprophylaxis will be eligible for study

primary_outcome.measure: Physician's Assessment of Efficacy of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Efficacy of treatment as assessed by physician was evaluated on the 5 point categorical scale: excellent, very good, good, fair, poor.

study_pop.textblock: The adult population (women and men) after major orthopedic surgery.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Dalteparin Sodium
group.description: Dalteparin Sodium (Fragmin) 2500 International Unit (IU)/0.2 milliliter (mL) and 5000 IU/2 mL subcutaneously (s.c) as per registered indications for 5 weeks.

group.title: Dalteparin Sodium
group.description: Dalteparin Sodium (Fragmin) 2500 IU/0.2 mL and 5000 IU/2 mL s.c as per registered indications for 5 weeks.

measurement_list.measurement: Data for this pre-specified outcome measure was collected and reported in individual participant listings but not statistically summarized for analysis.

measure.title: Thromboembolic Disease Assessment
measure.description: Thromboembolism is the formation of blood clot in the blood vessels due to an embolus (a detached intravascular mass capable of clogging arterial capillary beds at a site far from its origin).Thromboembolic disease was assessed based on clinical examination only (presence of symptoms).

measurement_list.measurement: Data for this pre-specified outcome measure was collected and reported in individual participant listings but not statistically summarized for analysis.
Data for this pre-specified outcome measure was collected and reported in individual participant listings but not statistically summarized for analysis.
Data for this pre-specified outcome measure was collected and reported in individual participant listings but not statistically summarized for analysis.
Data for this pre-specified outcome measure was collected and reported in individual participant listings but not statistically summarized for analysis.

outcome.title: Participant's Dosage Regimen
outcome.description: Approved dosage regimens for Fragmin in major orthopedic surgery included; (1): first dose of Fragmin 5000 IU in the evening before the day of surgery, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks; (2): first dose of Fragmin 2500 IU 2 hours before surgery, and a second dose of 2500 IU 8 to 12 hours later, not earlier than 4 hours after surgery, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks or (3): first dose of Fragmin 2500 IU 4 to 8 hours postoperatively, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks.
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

group.title: Dalteparin Sodium
group.description: Dalteparin Sodium (Fragmin) 2500 IU/0.2 mL and 5000 IU/2 mL s.c as per registered indications for 5 weeks.

measure.title: Participant's Dosage Regimen
measure.description: Approved dosage regimens for Fragmin in major orthopedic surgery included; (1): first dose of Fragmin 5000 IU in the evening before the day of surgery, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks; (2): first dose of Fragmin 2500 IU 2 hours before surgery, and a second dose of 2500 IU 8 to 12 hours later, not earlier than 4 hours after surgery, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks or (3): first dose of Fragmin 2500 IU 4 to 8 hours postoperatively, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks.
measure.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Risk Factors
outcome.description: Risk factors evaluated for vascular thromboembolism (VTE) were age (above 40 years, but age was not a strong risk factor as a prediction of potential VTE episode), gender (primarily females but males after 65 years also influenced VTE episode), obesity, pregnancy, liver disease, kidney disease, hormone therapy, immobilization, previous surgery, concomitant malignant disease, positive family history, varicose veins, smoking, chemotherapy, catheter in vein, Heart Failure III New York Heart Association (NYHA) and Heart Failure IV NYHA.
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

class.title: Heart failure III New York Heart Association(NYHA)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Thromboembolism

outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

group.title: Dalteparin Sodium
group.description: Dalteparin Sodium (Fragmin) 2500 IU/0.2 mL and 5000 IU/2 mL s.c as per registered indications for 5 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Thromboembolism
measure.description: Thromboembolism is the formation of blood clot in the blood vessels due to an embolus (a detached intravascular mass capable of clogging arterial capillary beds at a site far from its origin).
measure.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Bleeding
outcome.description: Major bleeding: defined as fatal bleeding, clinically overt bleeding causing a fall in hemoglobin more than or equal to 20 gram/litre (g/L) (2 g/decilitre [dL]), clinically overt bleeding leading to transfusion of more than or equal to 2 units of whole blood or red cells, or symptomatic bleeding in areas of special concern (intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular, intraspinal, pericardial, intramuscular with compartmental syndrome, or intraarticular). Minor bleeding was defined as bleeding that did not meet the definition of major bleeding.
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

group.title: Dalteparin Sodium
group.description: Dalteparin Sodium (Fragmin) 2500 IU/0.2 mL and 5000 IU/2 mL s.c as per registered indications for 5 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Bleeding
measure.description: Major bleeding: defined as fatal bleeding, clinically overt bleeding causing a fall in hemoglobin more than or equal to 20 gram/litre (g/L) (2 g/decilitre [dL]), clinically overt bleeding leading to transfusion of more than or equal to 2 units of whole blood or red cells, or symptomatic bleeding in areas of special concern (intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular, intraspinal, pericardial, intramuscular with compartmental syndrome, or intraarticular). Minor bleeding was defined as bleeding that did not meet the definition of major bleeding.
measure.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Participant's Global Evaluation of Treatment
outcome.description: Participant's global evaluation of treatment for overall response and comfort was evaluated on the four point categorical scale: excellent, good, fair and poor.
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Administration Schedule of Treatment
outcome.description: Administration schedule for Fragmin in major orthopedic surgery Included was categorized as; (1): first dose of Fragmin 5000 IU in the evening before the day of surgery, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks; (2): first dose of Fragmin 2500 IU 2 hours before surgery, and a second dose of 2500 IU 8 to 12 hours later, not earlier than 4 hours after surgery, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks or (3): first dose of Fragmin 2500 IU 4 to 8 hours postoperatively, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks.
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

group.title: Dalteparin Sodium
group.description: Dalteparin Sodium (Fragmin) 2500 IU/0.2 mL and 5000 IU/2 mL s.c as per registered indications for 5 weeks.

measure.title: Administration Schedule of Treatment
measure.description: Administration schedule for Fragmin in major orthopedic surgery Included was categorized as; (1): first dose of Fragmin 5000 IU in the evening before the day of surgery, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks; (2): first dose of Fragmin 2500 IU 2 hours before surgery, and a second dose of 2500 IU 8 to 12 hours later, not earlier than 4 hours after surgery, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks or (3): first dose of Fragmin 2500 IU 4 to 8 hours postoperatively, followed by daily doses of 5000 IU up to 5 weeks.
measure.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Compliant With the Treatment
outcome.description: Compliance was defined as participants documented with Dalteparin Sodium up to 5 weeks after initiation of thromboprophylaxis.
outcome.population: Data was collected but not statistically summarized for analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Hematoma
outcome.description: Hematoma is a localized collection of blood outside of a blood vessel. It includes subcutaneous hematoma and injection-site hematoma.
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all those participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Dalteparin Sodium
group.description: Dalteparin Sodium (Fragmin) 2500 IU/0.2 mL and 5000 IU/2 mL s.c as per registered indications for 5 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
